text:
Jean-Louis Servan-Schreiber (31 October 1937 – 28 November 2020) was a French journalist and human rights activist. He was the co-founder of "L'Expansion" and the founder of "Psychologies" and Radio Classique. He was the author of several books. He was born in Boulogne-Billancourt, France. He was a member of the Human Rights Watch from 2007 until his death.
Servan-Schreiber died on 28 November 2020 in Paris of COVID-19, aged 83.
